00040 #ifndef _linegroup_cpp
00041 #define _linegroup_cpp
00042 
00043 #include "datatypes.h"
00044 #include "vector3.h"
00045 
00046 namespace phys
00047 {
00048     // Just a few forward declarations to make wrapping some functionality to engine internals easier.
00049     class World;
00050     namespace internal
00051     {
00052             class Line3D;
00053     }
00054 
00055     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00056     /// @class LineGroup
00057     /// @headerfile linegroup.h
00058     /// @brief This is a group of consectutive line segments to be rendered together.
00059     /// @details This class stores a listing of points and renders thems as one
00060     /// object into the world provided.
00061     class LineGroup
00062     {
00063         /// @todo TODO: This class really should support rotation, the underlying implementation does.
00064         public:
00065             /// @brief Basic Constructor
00066             /// @details This creates a basic, empty, LineGroup.
00067             /// @param Parent_ This is a pointer to the world to render to.
00068             LineGroup(World *Parent_);
00069 
00070             /// @brief Default Destructor
00071             /// @details This safely tears down, and removes from the graphics system the LineGroup
00072             ~LineGroup(void);
00073 
00074             /// @brief This add Either a start pointing, or a line segment to the next point
00075             /// @details This adds a point that will be rendered as the endpoint of a line
00076             /// @param p The Point to be added.
00077             void addPoint(const Vector3 &p);
00078 
00079             /// @brief Access points by order they were added.
00080             /// @details This returns the point indicated by index. They start at 0, and increment from there
00081             /// @param index A Whole number which indicates which point to retrieve.
00082             const Vector3 getPoint(Whole index) const;
00083 
00084             /// @brief Get the amount of points used to define Line Segments
00085             /// @details This return the amount of points and therefore line segments. There will always be one more point
00086             /// Than line segments.
00087             /// @return A Whole Number which indicates the amount of points.
00088             Whole getNumPoints(void) const;
00089 
00090             /// @brief This changes a specific point
00091             /// @details This replaces a point specified by index with a new point
00092             /// @param index The index of the point to replace.
00093             /// @param value A point to replace the existing point with
00094             void updatePoint(Whole index, const Vector3 &value);
00095 
00096             /// @brief This adds Two points to the list
00097             /// @details This could add 2 line segments, be it simply adds two lines to the list, but if you don't care then this is an
00098             /// easy way to guarantee that a specific line segment be rendered.
00099             /// @todo TODO: In the future we will add a break in the line segment chain when this is called.
00100             /// @param start The first point to be added
00101             /// @param end The first point to be added
00102             void drawLine(const Vector3 &start, const Vector3 &end);
00103 
00104             /// @brief Renders the line segment chain.
00105             /// @details This send the Line segment information to the rending subsystem. PrepareForRendering() should be called first
00106             /// @todo TODO: PrepareForRendering should be rolled into drawLines, but this cannot happen until the physics debug rendererin gets more attention.
00107             void drawLines(void);
00108 
00109             /// @brief This assists in the rendering process
00110             /// @details This sends some of the data to the rendering subsystem to aid drawLines
00111             void PrepareForRendering();
00112 
00113             //Real getSquaredViewDepth(const Camera *cam) const;
00114 
00115             /// @brief How big would a circle need to be to encapsulate this
00116             /// @details This returns the radius the a circle would need to have to surround this line group.
00117             /// @return This returns a real number which indicates the radius.
00118             Real getBoundingRadius(void) const;
00119 
00120         private:
00121             /// @brief A pointer to the world that this LineGroup will render to.
00122             World *Parent;
00123 
00124             /// @brief A Pointer to the internal class that actually does the work.
00125             internal::Line3D *LineData;
00126     };
00127 }
00128 
00129 #endif
